meanings.definition: To move from one place to another
meanings.sent1: Birds migrate south for the winter.
meanings.sent2: Many animals migrate to find better food.
meanings.sent3: The clouds seem to migrate across the sky like slow travelers.
meanings.sent4: Thoughts migrate from one idea to the next in my mind.
meanings.sent5: Leaves migrate from the trees to the ground in autumn.

meanings.sent1: The tectonic plates slowly migrate over time.
meanings.sent2: The furniture had to migrate to make space for the new carpet.
meanings.sent3: The shadows migrate as the sun moves across the sky.
meanings.sent4: Emotions can migrate from happiness to sadness in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The colors on the chameleon's skin migrate to match its surroundings.

meanings.definition: To travel regularly to a new place for work or study
meanings.sent1: Many students migrate to the library every evening.
meanings.sent2: Workers migrate to the city for better job opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The books in the library seem to migrate from one shelf to another overnight.
meanings.sent4: Ideas can migrate between different fields of study.
meanings.sent5: The bees migrate to different flowers to collect nectar.
